result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deshawn Lamont Thompson Sr

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed: Scheduling Order for Jury Trial Dated 01-17-2023

Defendant Deshawn Lamont Thompson Sr in court.  Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court for Deshawn Lamont Thompson Sr.  Attorney Amanda Korin Kirklewski in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 09:00 am.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated October 14, 2022; received and filed.

2:39 PM Defendant Deshawn Lamont Thompson Sr in court.  Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court for Deshawn Lamont Thompson Sr.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services 09-23-2022 Supervision Report

Defendant Deshawn Lamont Thompson in court by video with Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont who appears in person.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Due to technical issues on behalf of the defendant Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility. Defendant to appear in person on the next date.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO TECHNICAL DIFFICULTIES: 
Defendant Deshawn Lamont Thompson in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Deshawn Lamont Thompson in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
